bibl.title: Academic Life of Late Antique Alexandria: A View from the Field.
bibl.note: Polish-Egyptian excavations at Kom el-Dikka. The newly excavated complex of lecture halls (late fifth-early sixth century A.D.), including the odeum, as a piece of evidence for the continuation and the vitality of the tradition of Alexandrian learning.

bibl.title: What Happened to the Ancient Library of Alexandria? â€“ Library of the Written Word. 3. The Manuscript World. 1

bibl.seg: MAJCHEREK Grzegorz, Academic Life of Late Antique Alexandria: A View from the Field.

Mostafa EL-ABBADI and Omnia Mounir FATHALLAH (Edd.), What Happened to the Ancient Library of Alexandria? = Library of the Written Word. 3. The Manuscript World. 1 (Leiden - Boston, 2008) pp. 191-206, 6 figg., 1 plan.

Polish-Egyptian excavations at Kom el-Dikka. The newly excavated complex of lecture halls (late fifth-early sixth century A.D.), including the odeum, as a piece of evidence for the continuation and the vitality of the tradition of Alexandrian learning.
